        Synthesis, Structure, and Electroluminescence of BR2q (R = Et, Ph, 2-Naphthyl and q = 8-Hydroxyquinolato)
        Wu, Qingguo; Esteghamatian, Mohammad; Hu, Nan-Xing; Popovic, Zoran; Enright, Gary; Tao, Ye; D'Iorio, Marie; Wang, Suning
        Chemistry of Materials (2000), 12 (1), 79-83CODEN: CMATEX; ISSN:0897-4756. (American Chemical Society)
        Three 8-hydroxyquinolato (q) boron compds. B(C2H5)2q (1), BPh2q (2), and B(2-naph)2q (3) have been synthesized by the reaction of 8-hydroxyquinoline with an appropriate BR3 compd. Compds. 1-3 have a tetrahedral geometry as demonstrated by the structure of 1 detd. by a single-crystal x-ray diffraction anal. Compds. 1-3 emit a green-blue color at λmax = 495-500 nm when irradiated by UV light. The electroluminescent (EL) properties of 2 and 3 were examd. by fabricating EL devices using 2 and 3 as the light-emitting layer, resp. The devices of 2 produce a yellow-green light with broad emission spectra, attributed to the formation of an exciplex of 2 with the N,N'-di-1-naphthyl-N,N'-diphenylbenzidine (NPB) in the hole transport layer while the intrinsic EL emission of compd. 3 was obsd. Both 2 and 3 were good electron transport materials in EL devices.

        Chen, Wei; Wang, Jia-Yu; Chen, Cheng; Yue, Qi; Yuan, Hong-Ming; Chen, Jie-Sheng; Wang, Su-Ning

        Hydrothermal syntheses, crystal structures and photoluminescent properties of three metal-cluster based coordination polymers containing mixed organic ligands
        Tao, Jun; Yin, Xin; Wei, Zan-Bin; Huang, Rong-Bin; Zheng, Lan-Sun
        European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2004), (1), 125-133CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Three novel metal-cluster based coordination polymers (MCCPs) [Zn4(μ3-OH)2(H2O)2(sip)2(4,4'-bpy)2]·3H2O (MCCP-4), [Cd4(μ3-OH)2(H2O)2(sip)2(4,4'-bpy)4]·H2O (MCCP-5) and [Cd6(μ3-OH)4(μ2-OH2)2(OH2)2(nip)4(4,4'-bpy)3]·3H2O (MCCP-6) [H2sip = 5-sulfoisophthalic acid, H2nip = 5-nitroisophthalic acid and 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridyl] were hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction studies. MCCP-4 crystallizes in the triclinic space group P‾1 with a 10.106(2), b 10.851(2), c 11.125(2) Å, α 105.66(3), β 112.63(3), γ 98.18(3)°, and Z = 2. MCCP-5 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/c with a 25.602(1), b 16.571(1), c 13.322(1) Å, β 92.524(1)°, and Z = 4. MCCP-4 and -5 consist of similar [M4(μ3-OH)2]6+ tetranuclear building units that are joined through sip and 4,4'-bpy ligands to generate a two-dimensional structure (MCCP-4) and a three-dimensional structure (MCCP-5), resp. MCCP-6 crystallizes in the triclinic space group P‾1 with a 14.295(2), b 14.472(2), c 20.204(3) Å, α 73.362(3), β 82.200(3), γ 62.769(2)°, and Z = 2. MCCP-6 contains unprecedented [Cd6(μ3-OH)4(μ2-OH2)2]8+ hexanuclear building units which are linked through nip and 4,4'-bpy ligands to afford a two-dimensional structure. The IR spectroscopy, thermal stability and photoluminescence of the three complexes were studied.

        Three interpenetrated frameworks assembly from a long multicarboxylate ligand and transition metal
        Wang, Huan-Yu; Gao, Shan; Huo, Li-Hua; Ng, Seik Weng; Zhao, Jing-Gui
        Crystal Growth & Design (2008), 8 (2), 665-670CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Three three-dimensional polymers, namely, [Zn(bpea)(H2O)]n (1, H2bpea = biphenylethene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid), [Cd(bpea)(H2O)]n (2) and [Ni(bpea)(4,4'-bipyridine)(pyridine)]n (3) have been synthesized by the hydrothermal reaction of ZnII, CdII or NiII salts with biphenylethene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid, and their mol. structures have been detd. using X-ray crystallog.         https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXksV2gsw%253D%253D&md5=8e1774bc66c7d550a927503a01ff6715
      33. 33
        Li, S. L., Lan, Y. Q., Ma, J. F., Yang, J., Wei, G. H., Zhang, L. P., and Su, Z. M. Cryst. Growth Des.2008 8 675 684
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        33
        Structures and Luminescent Properties of Seven Coordination Polymers of Zinc(II) and Cadmium(II) with 3,3',4,4'-Benzophenone Tetracarboxylate Anion and Bis(imidazole)
        Li, Shun-Li; Lan, Ya-Qian; Ma, Jian-Fang; Yang, Jin; Wei, Guo-Hua; Zhang, Lai-Ping; Su, Zhong-Min
        Crystal Growth & Design (2008), 8 (2), 675-684CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Seven coordination polymers, [Zn(BPTC)0.5(L1)0.5(H2O)] (1), [Zn2(BPTC)(L2)]·H2O (2), [Zn2(BPTC)(L3)2]·3H2O (3), [Zn2.5(BPTC)(L4)(OH)(H2O)] (4), [Zn2(BPTC)(L5)(H2O)2]·3H2O (5), [Cd2(BPTC)(L5)(H2O)]·H2O (6), and [Cd(BPTC)0.5(L6)]·H2O (7), where L1 = 4,4'-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)biphenyl, L2 = 4,4'-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, L3 = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-yl)butane, L4 = 1,4-bis(2-ethyl-imidazol-1-yl)butane, L5 = 1,3-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene, L6 = 1,2-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene, and BPTC = 3,3',4,4'-benzophenonetetracarboxylate ligand, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses and further characterized by elemental analyses, IR spectra, and thermogravimetric analyses. The structure of 1 exhibits a (4,6)-connected network with a (44·62)(44·610·8) topol. formed by L1 ligands connecting BPTC-Zn sheets. The structure of 2 is a chiral 3-dimensional network in which there exists a Zn-O helical chain which may transmit the chirality to the whole framework. In compd. 3, multicarboxylate ligands link L3-metal helical chains to generate a layer which is further connected by intermol. H bonds to form a 3-dimensional supramol. structure. In compd. 4, the L4-Zn sheets are connected by BPTC pillars to generate a 3-dimensional framework with a distorted α-Po topol. Compd. 5 shows infinite chains. Compd. 6 shows two kinds of novel infinite chains which are linked by π-π stacking interactions to form 2-dimensional supramol. sheets. Compd. 7 is a (3,4)-connected framework with a (62·8)2(62·84) topol. The structural differences among 1-4 indicate the importance of the flexibility of the ligands (L1-L4) for the framework formation of the coordination polymers. By varying the angular feature of the ligands (L5 and L6), compds. 5-7 were sepd. completely. In addn., the luminescent properties of these compds. are discussed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXitFertA%253D%253D&md5=ab5a8f7c80d7acce180bc962e13b6673
